thread.title: LeEco X10 could be the first smartphone to boast dual cameras at both the front and back
thread.title_full: LeEco X10 could be the first smartphone to boast dual cameras at both the front and back

title: LeEco X10 could be the first smartphone to boast dual cameras at both the front and back
text:
LeEco X10 could be the first smartphone to boast dual cameras at... LeEco X10 could be the first smartphone to boast dual cameras at both the front and back By - January 24, 2017 “The LeEco X10 is expected to offer 12MP + 12MP rear cameras and 15MP + 15MP selfie shooters” 
It appears that LeEco is working on a new high-end camera-centric smartphone. Ahead of an official announcement, the brand’s upcoming LeEco X10 smartphone has been spotted on GFXBench benchmarking website, which has revealed some of its key specs. If the GFXBench data is to be believed, the LeEco X10 could be the world’s first smartphone to boast dual cameras on both the front and back. 
As per GFXBench , the LeEco X10 will feature two 12-megapixel cameras with 4K video recording support at the rear. For selfies, the phone will get two 15-megapixel cameras with 2K video recording support. Looking at these camera specs, the device will offer some serious camera prowess, at least on the paper. 
As for the other specs, the LeEco X10 will feature a 5.5-inch quad-HD display, and will boot Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The device will be powered by a 2.3GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 820 processor, mated to 4GB or 6GB of RAM and Adreno 530 graphics. It will be available in either 32GB or 64GB internal storage variants. 
It’s worth mentioning that the LeEco X10 on the GFXBench could be just a testing device, and may not be launched commercially. We will update you as soon as the company officially confirms the phone.
